item.title: Getting started with security
item.description: High Level Introduction to Information Security # It is a basic human instinct to assess risk and to accept or take some kind of action on that risk. This is the essence of security, which is the body of knowledge that provides a framework around this instinct. Security defines three key concepts in a triangular paradigm - Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (The CIA paradigm). While it is common for society to believe that security is simply about protecting confidentiality, as a developer there is nothing done that does not fall somewhere under the banner of security.
